in.teramatrix.flint.driver.custom

Class TargetHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • in.teramatrix.flint.driver.custom.TargetHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.getkeepsafe.taptargetview.TapTargetSequence.Listener, java.lang.Runnable

    public class TargetHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.getkeepsafe.taptargetview.TapTargetSequence.Listener, java.lang.Runnable
    A class to handle all app tutorials (TapTarget) on different screens. For tutorial, a third party library TapTargetView has been used. And to store tutorial completion flags SPUtils shared preferences has been used.
    Author:
    mohsin.khan
    Date:
    12/12/2016

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private android.app.Activity activity
      To initialize TapTargetSequence and TapTarget
      private SPUtils spUtils
      To store completion flags permanently
      private java.util.ArrayList<com.getkeepsafe.taptargetview.TapTarget> tapTargets
      To manage all tutorials in a sequential manner.
      private android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar toolbar
      To display tutorials on ActionBar's MenuItem
      private java.lang.String tutorial
      It's nothing more than a screen name or tutorial location.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      TargetHandler(android.app.Activity activity, android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar toolbar, java.lang.String tutorial)
      Default constructor of the class to initiate all the necessary components

    • Field Detail

      • activity

        private android.app.Activity activity
        To initialize TapTargetSequence and TapTarget

      • toolbar

        private android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar toolbar
        To display tutorials on ActionBar's MenuItem

      • spUtils

        private SPUtils spUtils
        To store completion flags permanently

      • tapTargets

        private java.util.ArrayList<com.getkeepsafe.taptargetview.TapTarget> tapTargets
        To manage all tutorials in a sequential manner. If user cancels any tutorial, remaining tutorials will be shown continuously.

      • tutorial

        private java.lang.String tutorial
        It's nothing more than a screen name or tutorial location. In this version,
        SPUtils.TUTORIAL_ONE is for HomeFragment
        SPUtils.TUTORIAL_TWO is for OpenTicketFragment
        SPUtils.TUTORIAL_THREE is for UpdateActivity

    • Constructor Detail

      • TargetHandler

        public TargetHandler(android.app.Activity activity,
                     android.support.v7.widget.Toolbar toolbar,
                     java.lang.String tutorial)
        Default constructor of the class to initiate all the necessary components
        Parameters:
        activity - To initialize TapTargetSequence and TapTarget
        toolbar - To display tutorials on ActionBar's MenuItem
        tutorial - It's nothing more than a screen name or tutorial location. Please refer SPUtils's SPUtils.TUTORIAL_ONE, SPUtils.TUTORIAL_TWO or SPUtils.TUTORIAL_THREE for different screens.

    • Method Detail

      • target

        public void target()
        To show tutorials, call this method. It will decide automatically whether to show or not.
